g.text: Milankovitch cycles alter Earth's tilt and orbit over 1

• Siberian Traps (~252 MYA) - The Great Dying:
Large Igneous Provinces erupt for hundreds of thousands
of years. Sulfuric acid rain devastates vegetation. Th
A 10km impactor releases energy equivalent to billions
of nuclear bombs. Ejecta reentering the atmosphere heat
• Late Devonian Kellwasser Event (~372 MYA) - E
• Toarcian OAE (~183 MYA) - Black shales record
Oceanic Anoxic Events occur when circulation stalls. Su
lfate-reducing bacteria thrive in oxygen-depleted water
Every 1°C warming shifts climate zones ~150km poleward.
Ocean pH dropping 0.1 units represents a 30% increase
Marine regression can drop sea levels 50-100+ meters. C
auses include glaciation, tectonic uplift, or supercont
Reef-building organisms require narrow temperature, pH,
and light conditions. After collapse events, 'reef gap
A GRB within 6,000 light-years could halve Earth's ozon
e. Nitrogen oxides from atmospheric ionization would cr
• PETM (~56 MYA) - Carbon isotope spike suggest
Methane clathrates store 10,000+ gigatons of carbon. Wa
rming oceans can trigger runaway release. Methane oxidi
